properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong southwest winds expected this afternoon. An intense Pacific cold front approaching the coast this morning will move rapidly across the interior this afternoon. Southeast winds will rise abruptly to southwest 40 km/h with gusts to 70 or even 80 in the wake of the front. A few power outages are possible. Winds will diminish to light this evening as a ridge of high pressure builds in from the west. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-04-26T08:44:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-04-25T18:04:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3726941994.2020
Area: Fraser Canyon - north including Lillooet, Fraser Canyon - south including Lytton, South Thompson, Nicola, Chilcotin
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong southerly winds of 90 km/h are expected tomorrow afternoon over exposed coastal areas. An intense cold front will approach Haida Gwaii on Sunday morning and cross the mainland coast that evening. Southerly winds will increase Sunday morning. Exposed coastal areas can expect winds reaching 90 km/h beginning near midday. Winds will ease over Haida Gwaii by early Sunday evening, and mid-evening along the mainland coast. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-04-26T17:25:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-04-26T01:26:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3636755885.2020
Area: Haida Gwaii, North Coast - coastal sections
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Update: Flood Warning Continued For The Red River From Emerson To The Red River Floodway Inlet Control Structure
properties.Summary:
Description: Update: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. Manitoba Infrastructure's Hydrologic Forecast Centre has issued a Flood Warning on the Red River from Emerson to the Red River Floodway Inlet Control Structure due to high water flows. If you are in the affected area, be watchful of local waterways as flooding is likely to occur. Do not attempt to cross fast flowing waters or waters of unknown depth. Avoid flooded areas. Follow all directions given by local authorities. Listen for updates and take all necessary precautions to stay safe. Up-to-date information is available at www.gov.mb.ca/flooding and www.manitoba511.ca. Follow @MBGov and @MBGovRoads on Twitter or stay tuned to local media.
Expires: 2020-04-26T11:30:00-05:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization, 2020-04-25T11:33:12-05:00, AE4AD507-BC44-3EA2-968D-7E6F12D8E2DF
Area: Red River from Emerson to the Red River Floodway Inlet Control Structure
properties.Author: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain is expected or occurring. An area of Freezing rain will develop late tonight and is expected to gradually transition to snow during the morning hours. ### Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-04-26T19:49:32-00:00

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibilities in snow and blowing snow will occur in these communities beginning Sunday afternoon. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts. Potential for a severe thunderstorm squall line this afternoon. A strong Pacific cold front is forecast to move across the central interior this afternoon. In the wake of the front, winds will rise abruptly to southwest 40 km/h gusting to 70 km/h over all areas. There is also the potential for a line of thunderstorms to develop which could result in gusts as high as 90 km/h. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-04-26T09:29:26-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-04-25T18:04:26-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2228087266.2020
Area: Highway 97 - Clinton to 100 Mile House via Begbie Summit
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Summary:

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. A developing low pressure system will generate strong winds overnight with gusts up to 90 km/h possible. Winds diminishing from west to east this morning. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
